cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles E of Great Abaco Island, northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west toward the northwestern Bahamas, forecast to turn WNW tonight, then NW across the Florida Peninsula and into southern Georgia before curving north-northeast across the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (between Boca Raton and the Flagler/Volusia County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC (Storm Surge Watch covers this reach, including Savannah)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County Line FL to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from east-central Florida northward through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (forecast 2–4 ft for GA coast, so values could exceed 3 ft)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Thursday into early Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation above ground level possible along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with localized higher totals, capable of minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous surf/rip currents
